intro: Bornmuellera emarginata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bornmuellera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea tree species. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in heathland and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
